COMM: Igor was born in the Ukraine and his

123.text: size became a problem from a very early age.

126.text:
02:07
SVETLANA: When Igor was born he was growing

129.text:
too fast. At the age 4,5,6 months he already
was size of 1 year old kid. Usually when kids

137.text:
are born and if they are big size born, in
my home country actually people are happy.

143.text:
But when he was 6 months old and weighed 13
kilos I thought it was a little too heavy.

149.text:
A little too big. I went to see the doctors
and it was the first time he say to me it

155.text: has Gigantism, when he was six months old.

159.text:

COMM: Gigantism is caused by a tumour on the

163.text:
pituitary gland inside the brain. This tumour
produces an excess of growth hormone which

169.text:
is pumped into the body. If a person suffers
the brain tumour before the end of puberty

175.text:
then the condition is called acromegalic gigantism
and results in the patient growing to massive

180.text:
heights, like Igor. But if a person develops
the tumour post puberty then the condition

185.text:
is called acromegaly and the patient grows
outwards rather than upwards. Acromegaly affects

192.text:
three to four out of every million people
each year.

195.text:
03:16
DR JAKOBY: What most individuals notice right

198.text:
away is that there’s a characteristic facial
appearance of individuals with Acromegaly.

204.text:
The frontal bones become broadened and enlarged
and more prominent. The nose enlarges. The

211.text:
facial features and skin coarsen. The jaw
becomes more prominent. Another striking feature

216.text:
of Acromegaly is the significant enlargement
of the hands and feet and you read descriptions

222.text:
of patients with Acromegaly have spade like
hands and spade like feet. The fingers and

227.text:
toes thicken and the palms and soles widen
and get thickened as well.

231.text:
03:52
COMM: Both acromegaly and acromegalic gigantism

235.text:
can result in severe disfigurement, serious
disorders such as heart problems and strokes,

244.text:
04:06
COMM: Doctors in the Ukraine were unable to

248.text:
perform a much needed operation to remove
Igor’s brain tumour, meaning he continued

253.text:
to grow. So, when he was seven, and already
standing six feet tall, Igor and his mum moved

259.text:
to America, where doctors were able to carry
out the operation.

262.text:
04:25
SVETLANA: The surgery saved his life but he

267.text:
still was growing after surgery for many more
years. None of us expected that. I always

273.text:
thought that after surgery he would stop growing
but his brain was already affected by tumour

280.text: and still was producing growth hormone.

284.text:
04:46

But not until he’d hit an amazing 7ft 8’

296.text:
– making him one the tallest men in the
